title: Abstract Wikipedia Frame Schema — Event: Legal Case
description: JSON shape for the legal case / legal proceeding event frame, corresponding to the `event.legal_case` family in the frame inventory and the semantics/event/legal_case_event_frame.py model. This frame captures trials, appeals, and landmark judicial decisions for encyclopedic summaries.

frame_type.description: Frame family identifier. For legal case event frames the canonical value is "event.legal_case".

id.description: Optional stable identifier for this frame instance (e.g. an internal ID, page ID, or statement cluster ID). This is NOT the same as the case_id or the main event's own identifier.

main_event.description: Underlying semantic event representing the legal proceeding, following the shape of semantics.types.Event. Typically has event_type like "legal_case", "trial", or "appeal".

case_id.description: Optional local identifier or citation key for the legal case (e.g. docket number or internal case code).

case_name.description: Neutral case name, such as "Brown v. Board of Education".

court.description: Deciding court or tribunal, represented as an entity (e.g. 'Supreme Court of the United States').

jurisdiction.description: Jurisdiction or country/region under which the case falls (e.g. 'United States', 'European Court of Human Rights').

parties.description: Mapping from party-role labels to lists of entities in that role, for example {"plaintiff": [...], "defendant": [...], "appellant": [...], "respondent": [...]}

issues.description: Main legal issues or questions in neutral label form, not full sentences (e.g. ['racial segregation in public schools', 'freedom of expression']).

verdict_summary.description: Short neutral label for the outcome or holding of the case (e.g. 'segregation in public schools held unconstitutional').

verdict_date.description: More precise decision date or span, if needed in addition to main_event.time.

sentence_summary.description: Optional short neutral label for the sentence in criminal cases (e.g. 'life imprisonment', 'death sentence overturned').

precedent_summary.description: Short neutral description of how the case is viewed as precedent (e.g. 'landmark decision on school desegregation').

citations.description: Optional list of reporter citations or neutral reference strings associated with the case (e.g. ['347 U.S. 483']).

attributes.description: Additional structured attributes that do not warrant dedicated top-level fields. Example keys include 'panel_composition', 'lower_court', 'procedural_history', 'legal_doctrines'. Values are arbitrary JSON.

extra.description: Arbitrary extra metadata carried through normalization; not interpreted by the generic NLG layer but preserved for traceability and debugging.

EntityRef.description: Lightweight reference to a discourse entity, following the shape of semantics.types.Entity.

id.description: Stable identifier for the entity, e.g. a Wikidata QID ('Q42'), local database ID, or URI.

name.description: Preferred surface name or label, such as 'Supreme Court of the United States' or 'Brown v. Board of Education plaintiffs'.

gender.description: Coarse gender category for human entities (e.g. 'female', 'male', 'nonbinary', 'unknown').

human.description: Whether this entity is a human (useful for pronoun selection).

entity_type.description: Optional coarse type hint such as 'person', 'organization', 'court', 'jurisdiction', 'party_group'.

lemmas.description: Optional list of lemma-like labels associated with the entity (e.g. ['court', 'supreme_court']).

features.description: Arbitrary feature dictionary for morphology / constructions (e.g. grammatical person, number, animacy).

extra.description: Arbitrary metadata (IDs, codes, raw source row, etc.).

LocationRef.description: Reference to a location, following the shape of semantics.types.Location. May be used inside events if locations are modeled explicitly.

id.description: Stable identifier for the location (e.g. QID, geocode).

country_code.description: Optional ISO country code, such as 'US'.

features.description: Arbitrary feature dictionary, e.g. for preposition choice.

TimeSpan.description: Coarse time span or single date, following semantics.types.TimeSpan. Used here mainly for verdict_date, with years or full dates as needed.

start_year.description: Starting year, e.g. 1954. For a single date, this is the main year of interest.

approximate.description: If true, the timespan is approximate (e.g. 'around 1954').

EventRef.description: Lightweight reference to a semantic event (semantics.types.Event), such as a trial or appeal.

event_type.description: Free-form event type label, such as 'legal_case', 'trial', 'appeal'.

location.description: Where the event took place (entity or location).

participants.description: Optional mapping from participant roles (e.g. 'subject', 'court', 'party') to entities involved in the event.

court.name: Supreme Court of the United States

examples.verdict_summary: segregation in public schools held unconstitutional
examples.precedent_summary: landmark decision on school desegregation and equal protection
